xxl.core.collections.queues.io

Class QueueBuffer<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.collections.queues.AbstractQueue<E>
      • xxl.core.collections.queues.io.QueueBuffer<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Queue<E>

    public class QueueBuffer<E>
extends AbstractQueue<E>
    This class implements a queue interface. The aim of this class is to use a queue with a convereterContainer (ConverterContainer) (the usage is not restricted to this container class, other container hierarchy could be used). The queue is implemented as a double linked list of buckets (pages, blocks). Buckets are persisted in container that manages block (or byte arrays). Queue buckets are mapped to byte arrays using internal converter and user provided ConverterContainer. For initializing a queue three parameter needed: Container, serialized size of an entry and block size of lowest container: The following initialization pattern should be implemented, assume we want to manage a queue of Integer values: 1. we define a container, for example, BlockFileContainer Container blockFile = new BlockFileContainer (fileName, blockSize); 2. we need to provide a Converter for a objects stored in a queue Converter dataConverter = IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE; 3. we create a ConverterContainer Container queueConatainer = new ConverterContainer(blockFile, @link #getPageConverter(dataConverter)}); 4. we crete queue QueueBuffer( queueConatainer, IntegerConverter.SIZE, blockSize );

        public E dequeueObject()
                throws IllegalStateException,
                       NoSuchElementException
        Description copied from class: AbstractQueue
        Returns the next element in the queue (and removes it). The next element of the queue is given by its strategy.
        This method is invoked by dequeue and has to implement the peek procedure depending on the strategy and the used datastructure.
        Specified by:

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Description copied from class: AbstractQueue
        Removes all elements from this queue. The queue will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
        Note that the elements will only be removed from the queue but not from the underlying collection.
        This implementation iterates over this queue, calling the dequeue method for every element, in turn.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface Queue<E>
        Overrides:
        clear in class AbstractQueue<E>

      • peekObject

        protected E peekObject()
        Description copied from class: AbstractQueue
        Returns the next element in the queue without removing it. The next element of the queue is given by its strategy.
        This method is invoked by peek and has to implement the peek procedure depending on the strategy and the used datastructure.
        Specified by:
        peekObject in class AbstractQueue<E>
        Returns:
        the next element in the queue.
